definitions.definition: the ability to assess and initiate things independently.
examples: use your initiative, imagination, and common sense
synonyms: gumption "employers are looking for people with initiative"

definitions.definition: the power or opportunity to act or take charge before others do.
examples: we have lost the initiative and allowed our opponents to dictate the subject

definitions.definition: an act or strategy intended to resolve a difficulty or improve a situation; a fresh approach to something.
examples: a new initiative against car crime

definitions.definition: a proposal made by one nation to another in an attempt to improve relations.
examples: diplomatic initiatives to end the war

definitions.definition: (especially in some US states and Switzerland) the right of citizens outside the legislature to originate legislation.
